thread.title: What the Heck Is Hidden Fences, and Other Hilarious 2017 Golden Globe Errors
thread.title_full: What the Heck Is Hidden Fences, and Other Hilarious 2017 Golden Globe Errors

title: What the Heck Is Hidden Fences, and Other Hilarious 2017 Golden Globe Errors
text:
What the Heck Is Hidden Fences , and Other Hilarious 2017 Golden Globe Errors Expand Photo: Courtesy of Oxtail Gawdverified / @ThatDudeMCFLY (Twitter) 
During NBC’s Golden Globe Awards red carpet pre-show, presenter Jenna Bush Hager combined two nominated films dominated by African-American casts, Fences and Hidden Figures, and inadvertently created one of the biggest blunders of the evening: Hidden Fences . The Internet, of course, went wild, writing joke after joke on Bush Hager’s flub. But it wasn’t until Michael Keaton made the same mistake while presenting the award for Best Supporting Actress that Twitter really took off, starting a viral hashtag titled #GoldenGlobeErrors that conflated the titles of other movies with African-American casts. Where it goes from here is anyone’s guess: Here are some of the funniest errors that might just be arriving at a screen near you soon. 
— OXTAIL GAWD (@ThatDudeMCFLY) January 9, 2017 
— OXTAIL GAWD (@ThatDudeMCFLY) January 9, 2017 
— OXTAIL GAWD (@ThatDudeMCFLY) January 9, 2017 
— Brandale Randolph (@Brandale2221) January 9, 2017
